optionContent.general-partnership: In a general partnership two or more people share ownership of a single business and are jointly responsible for its assets and liabilities. [Learn more about General Partnerships.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=and%20potential%20partners-,General%20Partnership,-A%20General%20Partnership)
optionContent.c-corporation: A traditional Corporation (C Corp) is more complex than other business types and is generally suggested for larger, established companies with multiple employees. [Learn more about Corporations.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=C%2DCorporation%20(C%2DCorp))
optionContent.limited-liability-company: An LLC is one of the most common business structures. In an LLC, there can be one or multiple owners, and they are not personally liable for company debts. [Learn more about Limited Liability Companies.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=Limited%20Liability%20Company%20(LLC))
optionContent.limited-liability-partnership: Limited Liability Partnerships have general partners who own and operate the business, and limited partners who invest in the business, both types of partners have limited liability. [Learn more about Limited Liability Partnerships.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=Limited%20Liability%20Partnership%20(LLP))
optionContent.limited-partnership: Limited Partnerships have general partners who own and operate the business, and limited partners who invest in the business but have limited liability and oversight. [Learn more about Limited Partners.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=Limited%20Partnership%20(LP))
optionContent.s-corporation: A Corporation with an S Corporation Tax Designation (S Corp) is similar to a C Corporation except that the business is not taxed separately from the owners. S Corps are also very similar to Limited Liability Companies (LLCs), but with more limitations. You may elect S Corp status separately after you form and register for tax and employer purposes. [Learn more about Corporations with an S designation.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=S%2DCorporation%20(S%2DCorp))
optionContent.sole-proprietorship: In a sole proprietorship you alone own the company and are responsible for its assets and liabilities. [Learn more about Sole Proprietorships.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=as%20legal%20structures).-,Sole%20Proprietorship,-Sole%20Proprietorship%20is)
optionContent.nonprofit: Nonprofits are a type of C Corporation, but unlike a for-profit corporation, a nonprofit organization has a mission to benefit the public rather than generating profit. Nonprofits belong to the public, are governed by a board of trustees, and can qualify for tax-exemption. [Learn more about Nonprofits.](https://business.nj.gov/pages/choose-a-business-structure#:~:text=2%%20of%20shares-,Nonprofit,-Nonprofits%20are%20a)

default.placeholder: If you are an LLC, Corporation, nonprofit, LP, or LLP, we will automatically add your formation documents once you [Form Your Business](/tasks/form-business-entity) on our site.

default.lockedFieldTooltipText: This information cannot be changed because it was submitted to the NJ Department of Treasury.
default.contactInformationSubText: We'll only use these details to contact you about your Business.NJ.gov account. Changes you make here won't affect your myNewJersey account and won't change your information on any official business forms with New Jersey (for example, tax filings). To update your myNewJersey login, visit [myNewJersey Account Settings](https://myt1.nj.gov/edituser/EditUserProfile).
default.annualReportDeadlineSubText: Tell us when you officially started your business and we'll add your Annual Report deadline to your Calendar.
default.notificationProductNewsDescription: News about the website, feature releases, service updates, and opportunities to provide feedback.
default.errorDefaultTextBody: Review your information in the fields marked below.
default.escapeModalBody: You've made changes to your profile that haven't been saved. If you leave this page now, those changes will be lost.
default.successTextBody: Based on your answers, you may see updates to your Business.NJ.gov account experience.
default.escapeModalQuestion: Would you like to save your changes before leaving?
default.typesOfNotificationsSubText: Select the types of updates that matter most to your business.
default.filterCertificationsAndFundingSubText: Answer a few questions to find State certifications and funding programs in your For You section.
default.notificationIncompleteTasksDescription: Stay on track with helpful nudges when you leave something unfinished.
default.errorTextBody: Review your information in the ${fieldText} marked below.
default.notificationNewsletterDescription: Get updates on the latest State news that could impact your business.
default.contactAndNotificationsSubText: Choose how you want to stay informed. You can customize how you get messages, and you can choose which topics to receive.
default.permitsAndLicensesSubText: Answer a few questions to find out what licenses and permits you may need and discover funding programs to help your business grow. New items will appear on your Starter Kit or your For You section.
default.cannabisLocationAlert: Check if your local government allows a cannabis license.
default.securityMattersText:
- You can update your contact information and notification preferences at any time.
- We will **never** ask for your password, banking details, or Social Security number in an email or text.
- All official messages will always come from **address@business.nj.gov** or appear in your account dashboard.
- If you ever get an email that looks suspicious, report it at [cyber.nj.gov/report](https://cyber.nj.gov/report).
default.locationBasedRequirementsSubText: If you require any permits or licenses based on your businesses location or renovation needs, new tasks will be available for you to complete.
